lines.gurmukhi: hrdI Aau cUnw imil Arun brn jYsy cqur brn kY qMbol rs rUp hY
lines.transliteration_english: Haradee Au Choonaa Mili Aroun Baran Jaisay , Chatur Baran Kai Tanbol Ras Roop Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As turmeric and lime when mixed produce red colour, but when betel leaf, lime, betelnut and catechu are all brought together, a very deep red colour is produced;

lines.gurmukhi: dUD mY jwvnu imlY diD kY bKwnIAq KwNf GiRq cUn imil ibMjn AnUp hY
lines.transliteration_english: Doodh Mai Jaavanu Milai Dadhi Kai Bakhaaneeata , Khaand Ghrit Choon Mili Binjan Anoop Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As a small cogulent added to the milk set it as curd but sugar, flour and clarified butter produces a very tasty dish;

lines.gurmukhi: kusm sugMD imil iql sY Pulyl hoq skl sugMD imil Argjw DUp hY
lines.transliteration_english: Kousam Sougandh Mili Til Sai Dhulayl Hota , Sakal Sougandh Mili Aragajaa Dhoop Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: An extract of flowers when mixed with sesame oil become scented oil, but mixing of saffron musk, sandalwood and rose make a very fragrant product called argaja;

lines.gurmukhi: doie isK swDsMgu pMc prmysr hY ds bIs qIs imly Aibgiq aUp hY ]122]
lines.transliteration_english: Doi Sikh Saadhasangu Panch Paramaysar Hai , Das Bees Tees Milay Abigati Oop Hai ?122?

Shabad OS B.translation: So would two Sikhs together make a holy congregation while five of them would represent the Lord. But where ten, twenty or thirty like-minded Sikhs engrossed in the love of the Guru meet, their praise is beyond description. (122)
